text: One of the best pumpkin ales Ive ever had. Great spice, pumpkin, and boozy aromas. Nice sweet pumpkin and vanilla flavours. Booze on the finish. Excellent.

Bottle. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy woody pumpkin aroma with weak hints of bourbon. Has a fruity malty spicy woody bourbon and pumpkin flavor with hints of caramel. Has a fruity malty spicy woody pumpkin and caramel finish.

750 mL corked bottle poured, bottled on 9/8/14. Cellared 2 years, waiting for an occasion. Copper amber pour with a lasting head. Complex aroma fronted with oak, and with cinnamon, vanilla, gingerbread like spices, and chocolate. Flavor is a dry oak and vanilla. Spicy malt, a ton of pumpkin. Mellow bourbon notes seem to be created with this bill. Remains to be just a touch sweet. Explosive holiday beer with a ton of flavor. Oak dominant, and a very impressive beer as an overall. Very nice.

On tap at Hops & Pie. Clear amber appearance with a beige head and light lacing. Aroma of mild oak, caramel malt, toffee, light pumpkin and fall spices. Similar flavor, rich, malty and spicy with light barrel aged notes adding some complexity. Medium to full body with a lingering, light boozy finish. Interesting.
Pours orange deep with a beige head, aroma of toffee, caramel, fruits, pumpkin and vanilla, flavor of toffee, caramel, spices, pumpkin, medium to full bodied
Alcohol content matches the yearly date for Halloween. The growler place I drank this at called the brewery Unita. Great, strong, tasty beer.

Listed as 11% uinta pumkin ale, cant be the dubhe or the la quinta, heheheh. Ever so slight spiced autumn aroma. No co2. Big and black, want to be large and in charge. Nice lacing. Sweeter pumpkin spices initially. Turn volatile. Impressions of addiction. Strong, volatile. Does not hide alky well. Gets in yer face. over the top. Too much brother. Not impressed, Tastes like a liquor in the end. Turns rude imperial stout in the finish. Almost invokes the gag effect, there is so much alky in this. This is not about beer, its about catching a buzz in the fall, HAHAAH!!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 750ml bottle from Sendiks in Brookfield, shared with bananbi11. Reddish amber pour with an off-white head. Sweet malts. Tangy fruits and berries. Some spices, but not too pumpkin-y. Much more of a strong ale. Medium to fill bodied. Some alcohol. Blend is solid. Finishes sweet and lightly boozy. For a pumpkin brew, not too - which is a good thing. Uinta stuff, solid as ever. 13.7

Bottle from Lulus. Nice pour, muddy brown with initial high foamy head. Woody , earthy aroma, pumpkin kicks in in the taste, not the pie spice. More barrel notes here in the flavor . Alcohol burn comes Kate, but finishes if off really nicely. Glad this was my first of the season, ad ill be burned out on them shortly. Well done.
Pours orange to amber with little to no head. Aroma is pumpkin and bread yeast with malt notes over alcohol. Alcohol bite overpowers subtle pumpkin. And the repeats are flammable.
Pours amber with frothy white head; pumpkin pie and vanilla aromas from the oak; spicy rich palate with alcohol burn in the finish. Nice.
Pours a dark golden amber with fluffy head. Aromas of dark fruits, spice, and cinnamon. Flavors of pumpkin, caramel, all spice, nutmeg.

Poured from a 22 Oz corked bomber into a pint glass. The appearance is a dark copper color with a medium sized tan head. The aroma is a fantastic blend of fruit, spices and malt. The taste is a very nice mix of fruit, spice, hops and oak. A really good pumpkin ale.
Great aroma fall spices. Poured amber with little head. You can taste all the fall species ( cinn, allspice, pumpkin,and bourbon in the back palate)

Poured into a snifter.

4.25 A: Clear deep amber color. Two fingers of beige creamy/frothy head. Retention is good for a beer this big and plenty of lacing is left.

4.25 S: Lots of pumpkin spices - cinnamon, allspice, cardamom, clove, ginger. Pumpkin meshes well with an intense caramel maltiness. Touch of toastiness. Oak adds another layer of complexity with just a hint of vanilla.

4.0 T: Perfectly sweet - in the moderate range. Caramel, oak, and cinnamon are the strongest flavors. The other spices mentioned above arent far behind. Vanilla, toastiness, and a hint of brown sugar.

4.0 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Light to moderately creamy. Smooth with a light tannic finish.

4.0 D: Really good beer. Love pumpkin beers.

★ 762 characters


DavoleBomb, Feb 17, 2015

It pours a ruby red color with a slightly off white full head. There is pronounced lacing as the head retreats. There are aromas of pumpkin, bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, other spices, hints of oak, and alcohol. The flavors present are pumpkin, bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, spices, oak, and toast. It is moderately bodied, but fairly smooth. There is pronounced alcohol warming, but it is not over bearing or hot.
Bottle shared by BelgianBeerGal. Deep orangish brown with light beige head. Aroma is spicy and sweet. Malty with a spicy finish.

Florida bottle enjoyed in TX. Pours a clear bronze color with a small khaki head. The aroma is vegtal pumpkin, cinnamon and nutmeg like a speculaas. Very mellow and malty flavor that finishes spicy. Great fall beer.

Pours a cloudy dark bourbon color with an ample, long-lasting beige head. Pumpkin pie nose with some underlying fruitiness. Healthy mouthfeel, which lends itself to the largeness of the flavor. Drinks like a Barleywine with a sliver of pumpkin pie dunked in it.

750 ml bottle thanks to drsilverworm. The beer is a clear brown color with a beige head of foam. The aroma bas strong oak character with more rounded spice notes. The taste has strong wood character, just like the aroma. Earthy bitterness in the back end. Big body and lower carbonation.

750 ml bottle - 5.99 at Chicago-Lake in Minneapolis bottled 9/2015, this could probably rest for a year or so. Pour a gorgeous transparent mahogany with beige white head with good retention. A very attractive beer. Nose is very full - rich deeply caramelized grain notes, raisin, nuttiness and a touch of blended scotch smoothed out by a background of oak. A thick creamy palate and flavors not only match the big aroma but actually double down - along with the residual sugars of the deep and nutty caramelized grain, the flavor actually has a level of umami along with a well-integrated and pleasantly warming note of alcohol. Finishes just a bit rough with some of the big and mildy bitter flavors of alcohol lingering too long on the tongue. The biggest pumpkin beer Ive tried - Id probably style it as a pumpkin barley wine if such a thing existed. As such, it is a refreshingly unique American creation.
Cloudy brown thin beige head; aroma is malty; flava is sweet malt with touch of spice and wood; feels medium with decent fizz; finishes tangy mildly bitter

Bottled September 18, 2013 and enjoyed November 22, 2015 in pint glass.

Look - I thought I would need to pour it aggressively to get any head but was wrong. Poured a second glass down the side to get slightly less than a finger of tan head. Head that is there does stick around. Clear amber/clay color. A little sediment. 

Smell - Bourbon. Pumpkin. Cinnamon. Vanilla. Cherry. 

Taste - Two years did this beer well BUT it is still a pumpkin beer. Cinnamon. Booze. Pumpkin. 

Feel - It sits much better than fresh pumpkin beers Ive had. Smooth and creamy. Carbonation doesnt really translate to the feel. 

Overall - This bottle was a little over two years old. It is still a pumpkin beer but I like the subdued taste with aging.

Strong pumpkin ale with a good balanced pumpkin flavor. Has a slight sour finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice touch on a seasonal classic. Not as good as the originator of the style "Buffalo Bill's Brewery's Original pumpkin ale but not not bad. Pretty high ABV, which at 10.31 is not only Halloween trick, it's also a treat .

750ml bottle pours a murky orange with a ring of white head. Nose is blended with root veg and brown sugar, spice too, cinnamon, nutmeg. Flavor is spicy, light pepper, root veg, cinnamon. Full bodied finish. Missing some of that barrel.
Bottle at the DC Gathering. Golden amber with off-white head. Aromas of caramel, pumpkin, oak. Tastes of booze, caramel, oak, pumpkin, malt. Medium body with a dry finish.

Bottle. Decent aroma of vanilla, nutmeg, pumpkin pie/bread, spice. Huge flavor has some harsh elements of spicy bourbon, malt and hop. And oak. Barrel aged to a fault. Theres too much power to the aging process in this one.

[7594-20150827] 750mL bottle. Fruity jam toast and pumpkin pie aroma. Hazy, dark red body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Sweet spiced pumpkin and toasted malt flavour. Medium-full body. Interesting. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5
(w/ Big Red, blankboy, HogTownHarry, jercraigs)
31 oct 2915, bottle. Dark Amber. Nose is sweet, pumpkin spice, actually smells like pumpkin pie. Full body and moderately fizzy. Pumpkin pie, cloves, and a little too much wood.

750 ml bottle. Appearance: Deep brown, murky, moderate white head. 
Aroma: Strong oaky vanilla notes, cherry, with only a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg. 
Taste: Rich toasted maltiness with strong woody oak character and vanilla. Moderately strong bitterness with only a touch of pumpkin spicing with cinnamon and nutmeg. 
Mouthfeel: Medium to heavy body with slight creaminess, low carbonation. 
Finish: leaves a lingering woody oak and cinnamon flavor on the tongue. 
Overall: One of the best pumpkin beers Ive had, with strong barrel characteristics that dominate the flavor profile, with minimal pumpkin spicing in the background. A nice warmer for the colder temps of the season.
Tap at Happy Gnome. Rich clear orange pour with a soapy white head. Clove, cinnamon, nutmeg. Some vanilla and light oak. Slightly dry late. Very tasty.

(bottle) Pours a deep red color with an off-white head that forms a ring around the snifter. Aroma is strong of cinnamon, pumpkin pie, vanilla, oak, ginger, clove, and a little butterscotch with some apple emerging with further warming. Not bad at all. Flavor possesses a hit of pumpkin pie, more heavy cinnamon and hot ginger, with a lingering and drying vanilla to oak finish thats interspersed with snappy clove kicks. Little bit of pie crust emerges on the finish too. Mouthfeel is full and weighty with minimal carbonation. Some booze heat is detectable, but not as much as I expected.
Bottle. It poured an orange color with an off-white head. The aroma was of pumpkin, cinnamon, and some nutmeg. The taste was of pumpkin and spices with a creamy mouthfeel and a spicy finish. Not bad.

Orange sh brown. Nose of light fruity pumpkin, spice, and toasted malt/caramel. Flavor pumpkin, somewhat vegetal, with spice and thick, chewy caramel malt. Light notes of brown sugar and darkfruit. Didnt catch much oak.

on tap @ Party Town (Friday Night Flights) / Florence KY --- Aroma of oak and malt. Clear amber brown color, beige head cover, splotches of lace. Taste is evenly divided caramel malt and bitter pumpkin, joined by light spice in a mildly carbonated swallow. No hops are really needed in a decidedly long and and noticeably alcoholic finish. Strong, very warm, one I would not drink regularly.
Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a glass. Clear Amber with no head. Aroma is pumpkin, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste oak, pumpkin, and hints of alcohol.

[Bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o j&m] Pours a deep dark amber with an average size lasting frothy tan head. Aroma of pumpkin spice and pumpkin first followed by caramel malt, light hops and a hint of oak. Nice flavour of caramel malt, pumpkin, light hops, light spices, some oak and a bit of vanilla. Alcohol is fairly well hidden. Medium bodied. Fantastic.
Good pumpkin. A little sweet. Clear amber pour with off white head. Aroma pumpkin and spice. Taste is good, but a little to sweet. Enjoyable.

draft that poured a dark orange color with no head or lacing. the initial aroma is of oak, bourbon, pumpkin, vanilla, nutmeg, clove and cinnamon. the flavor was much more and full of flavor. omg the bourbon barrel of oak and vanilla hints plus the punch of pumpkin in your mouth followed by the spices of cinnamon. nutmeg and clove...blended so nicely together...wow..this is a high powered fragrant and delicious beverage.

This beer has a higher rating than the average but this bottle was aged in a bottle for two years after being aged in oak. Delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I could smell this from 10 feet away. Good strong aroma of pumpkin pie spice, oak and booze. They even got the crust in the scent. Beautiful crimson/brown color with a tiny amount of off white foam. Tastes very oaky with all of the spices from the aroma. Strong vanilla notes throughout and no ABV detected despite the fact that its 10.3%. Very good for the style.

Bottle dated 08/29/13.
This was poured into a snifter.
The appearance was a semi-dark to bronzed dark brown color with a one finger white to off white foamy head that dissipated practically immediately. Lacing was mostly messy, and kinda stringing itself all over the place.
The smell started off with boozy sweet sticky pumpkin spices, ginger, slight allspice, and slight cinnamon. Light breadiness warms into balance it out, damn, and wow!
The taste was boozy sweet with subtle balancing sweet pumpkin spices really nicely. There was a subtle sweet boozy aftertaste running into a sweet sticky finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with an awesome sipping quality about it. For a 2013 bottle, damn and wow, this one really held up, holy crap and a half! Yeah, the booziness is there, but damn, how it really feels, yeah, its not too sticky (cloying), but just feels real good.
Overall, recommend, damn right, I recommend, why is everyone turning to STs Pumking these days when theres a stellar brewer out in Utah who knows damn right what theyre doing....oh and this is aged...I can only imagine what this is like when fresh.

750ml bottle from Kenny Road Market: copper pour with frothy light tan head. aroma of yeasty, pumpkin spice, oak, vanilla. tastes are super spicy pumpkin, not overly sweet, woody. yeah, Im not a pumpkin beer fan, so... this is a lot of it.

2015-08-26. Lightly hazy dark amber brown body with a large creamy beige head. 4+ Aroma has a big pumpkin aroma on first pour, followed by spice. A bit of nutmeg and all spice? Mild alcohol character. Flavour is pleasant. Sweet malty core with fruity pumpkin, moderate spice. Light oak undertones and some Vanilla notes as it warms. 7++ Smooth average plus to medium bodied palate, soft carbonation. 3+ My notes struggle to elaborate on it, but everything just comes together really nicely. Bottle cellared several months from Ye Old Spirit Shop, Frederick, MD.
Amber with a small white head - Huge spice aroma - Good spicy flavour with pumpkin and other spices - Huges spicy finish that lasts - This was quite good and the alcohol is hidden

Originally rated on 10/9/14. Burnished amber body, the cap started out thick and fizzy but quickly settled into a thin slightly brownish ring. Aromas of pumpkin, allspice, cinnamon and as it warms the oak comes out and some hints of syrup. Flavor is stiff with the booze leaping out, subsiding momentarily and letting a little pumpkin and spices out. slight bitter almost metallic presence in the finish. The overwhelming alcohol just kills something that could have been pretty good.

Tallahassee, Fl. - Market Square Liquors - 750 ml cage-corked bottle. Slightly murky dark copper, light filmy off-white head, brief lacing. Aroma has some pumpkin spice notes, some like date-like fruitiness, Flavor is full-bodied with some solid spiciness reminiscent of pumpkin pie, nutmeg, some ripening vegetables, a touch of dates and raisins in the finish. Mouthfeel has a nice, thick smoothness to it. Slight booziness in the finish, but overall pretty solid,

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond. Thanks beerandbeyond. Hazy brown with small brownish head. Very sweet aroma, spicy with notes of pumpkin, clove, cinnamon, toffee and tart. Very sweet and spicy flavor, notes of clove and toffee, some maltiness, notes of pumpkin, cinnamon, plum and bourbon. Moderate carbonation, medium to full-bodied.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbeyond. Nice deep reddish amber-brown with a beige head. Aroma of pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, malt, caramel and some cookie. Sweet flavor with caramel, a bit of cookie, pumpkin, spices, and a light vanilla hint. Rounded mouthfeel. Decent.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours deep amber, nose is pumpkin, vanilla, cloves, caramel, taste is similar, fruity.

750ml bottle to the dome c/o Elise. Wow, the spices still dominate...wouldve thought the barrel would come through more. A monster of a pumpkin beer sure, but not seeing how that is desirable. Kind of gimmicky, not one Id seek out again. There is some vegetal pumpkin that is nice to see in the style. Its a beast, but thats about it.

Dark copper pour with a light brown head. Aroma is pumpkin, spices, oak. Taste is oak that mellows out the pumpkin, nutmeg, cinnamon, pumpkin pie in a liquid form. Oaky and dry. Alcohol is well hidden. Great lacing. Little sweet, and thick. IMHO, the best pumpkin beer I tasted this 2014 season.

Aroma: oaky, nutmeg, vanilla, and other spices. Lots of pumpkin and spices while drinking.

Appearance: deep clear amber with a thick white/tan head

Taste: initial sweetness with a light bitter, medium sweetness finish. 

Mouthfeel: sticky, light to medium bodied.
Bottle from recent BA trade. Poured clear amber with thick white head. Aroma of oak pumpkin spice sweet vanilla. Light carb med bod. Tastes similar to aroma with more wood

Bottle... Pours clear and burnt-orange with copper highlights and a mid-sized, creamy, beige head. The aroma offers pumpkin, then vanilla, then spices, and then caramel - in order of big to subtle. Full-bodied with an oily mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor is a holiday swirl of pumpkin, sweet vanilla, caramel and a healthy quantity of tannic bitterness. Bittersweet long-lasting finish. Very nice!

Large 2014 bottle. 

Pours red-brown with a fine head that leaves ample sticky lacing. 

Flavor matches Uintas description, with vanilla, oak and bourbon from the barrel aging, medium and dark malts, and pumpkin and pumpkin spices. 
Weaknesses are a less than optimal blend of flavors and overly obvious high ABV. The aroma is not plaqued by these issues and, consequently, is better than the flavor.
Pour from the bottle is dark brown with an off white head, Aroma is roasted, a little sour notes, maybe toffee as well, taste is pumpkin and a little toffee, finish is a smooth and lightly sweet

Beautiful clear brown/amber pour with thin tan head. Aromas of caramell and spice. Very malty with the brewer-stated hints of bourbon. Not much flavor of the pumpkin spice, but extrememely smooth sipping and mouthfeel.
The aroma has caramel spices and a bit of pumpkin. The appearance is deep amber. The taste is like the aroma but a bit cardboard like. The palate is smooth. Overall this is decent but not all that.

This beer gas plenty of faults. The first sip feels flat with hints of what could be something great. There is a bit of pumpkin in the middle with a mild spicy. The rest falls flat at the end

Draught at Downtown Spirits, SeattleDark amber to brown color with creamy head. Fruity, sweet, spicy aroma, with rum traces. Sweet malty flavor, biscuity, rum, raisins, and moderate spices. Warming alcohol in the final. Excellent.

Pours mahogany with a small beige head. Smells of pumpkin, oak, hints of spice. Taste is hints of vanilla, spice, booze, pumpkin, and a touch of caramel. Medium-bodied with a thick texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Uinta Crooked Line Lakes Jacked Imperial Pumpkin finishes with a slight booziness and pumpkin spice.

On tap poured a clear ruby orange hue w/ a small frothy off-white head and broken lacing. Light boozy spiced aroma. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a moderate bitter finish of short duration. Tastes are pumpkin, cloves, cinnamon, brown sugar, and nutmeg. Full bodied, syrupy mouthfeel, and a warm finish.

Bottle. Brown. Aroma is pumpkin spice, nutmeg, and bourbon. The taste follows highlighting the oak and vanilla of the bourbon. Low carb, smooth and warm feel. Good stuff.

On tap at Yardhouse in San Diego. Pours a very dark clear amber. Thin off white head. Aroma is slight pumpkin. Vanilla. Flavor is really nice. The pumpkin is there but also bourbon vanilla oak. Really complex but it seems to work. Thinner bodied. Alcohol is noticeable. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a large bottle into a pint glass to drink. The beer had a deep, clear ruby red color with an average-sized foamy white head with shorter retention, but good cling and lacing. The beer had a strong oak barrel aroma with notes of caramel, bourbon, pumpkin, and various spices, and a bit of vanilla. Its taste was a fairly bitter oak barrel flavor mixed with bourbon and a bit of sweetness from vanilla, along with some undertones of pumpkin and spice. The beer had a fairly thick but dry mouthfeel with a noticeable alcohol presence and pretty strong carbonation.  Thank you to Eric and Kristin for the generous prize, and to Siobhan for sharing!
I may be in the minority here but I prefer the non barrel aged version. The pumpkin spice notes are overwhelmed by the flavors of the barrel. Too much bourbon here for me.

Bottle pour at Evernote. Aroma is maple, cinnamon, sugar, vanilla, alcohol. Taste is rich and chewy burnt sugar, pumpkin spices, bourbon. One of the more interesting pumpkin beers but much too sweet and boozy for me.
Pours a beige-orange color with aroma of nutmeg, cinnamon, clove, and pumpkin. Pumpkin pie spice flavor with some pumpkin, vanilla, and wood. Very nice beer.

Poured from bomber. Rich brown copper color with off white head. Caramel malt aroma with cinnamon, nutmeg., ginger and bourbon. Flavors starts with a sweet caramel malt, brown sugar and vanilla. Followed with pumpkin spices of cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger. Some oak notes and bourbon booziness in finish. A nice complex pumpkin beer.
Really well done. Has a strong pumpkin pie aroma. The oak is very prominent abd has a strong alcahol finish.

Pumpkin with a lot of spices.

Clear red with a thin foam. Pumpkin and spice on the nose. Great body and spice on the palate without being overwhelming or off balance. Oak adds a nice complement.
A lots of oak for this pumpkin beer. Fantastic nose. Great carbonation. Notes of chocolate, pumpkin and vanilla. Solid brew.

Aroma: Pumpkin, wine.
Appearance: Clearish bronze......medium white head. 
Taste. Spicy pumpkin, apple. Tart .
Low carbonation.

Good.

On tap at the Beer Baron. It pours a clear, very dark orange color with an off white head. The aroma has a lot of bready malt and nutmeg, cinnamon, ginger and some veggie squash. The flavor is more oaky than the aroma with strong cinnamon, nutmeg spice, caramel malt and spicy oak in the finish. It has a big thick malty body with a spicy alcoholic finish. A pretty darn good strong pumpkin beer.

Not bad at all. Lots of your typical pumpkin pie aroma. A lot of oak here. By a lot I mean this is oak with some pumpkin. Not well barreled, and not a favorite style anyway. Tap at scion thanks to radagast.

Poured into a snifter at Edgars house. Deep brown-copper pour with a slight oily slickness. Small tan head with ring. Aroma is quite nice...smells like fall. Some spice notes with the deep malts, caramel, vanilla, pumpkin. Almost like a Fall Yankee candle. LOL. The taste is pumpkin, heavy malts, caramel, brandy, booze, oak barrel, and vanilla. Somewhat slick mouth with a medium to full body. Finish is heavy flavored and boozy. Very good. Not a huge fan of this style but this was very good.

Smooth pumpkin ale pours dark mahogany with a strong spicey smell but tastes sweeter. High ABV at 10.31%, another fine offering from Uinta. Nice autumn beer. Poured from a 750mL bottle.

Bottle. Dark ruby with almost no head. Aroma is pumpkin and vanilla. Taste follows and adds some wood from the oak and a slightly weird earthy aftertaste. Slightly thin mouthfeel, moderate carb and medium finish. Prominent booze. Would be very good if not for the aftertaste.

red brown pour big tan head. Aroma of huge cinnamon and nutmeg, some pumpkin. tastes big nutmeg kick, can taste the alcohol some oak. Not sweet. 10.2 is a doozy with pelenty of warmth. Boozy candle territory.

Pours from bottle into a tulip with a dark auburn color and rich tan colored head. Head retention is moderate but retains lacing through the glass. The aroma is huge with pumpkin, malt & nutmeg. Nice molasses and sweet malt upon first taste that finishes with pumpkin, spice and bourbon. A great fall beer!

bottle, pours a very pretty dark orange red with nice head and lacing. big nose of pumpkin, oak, bourbon. Very surprisingly balanced taste, the pumpkin matches really well with the bourbon notes. count me impressed.

Malty, spices, cinnamon, apple pie, rich. Sticky sweetness, peaches compote. Light roast, clearly barrel aged. Lovely but lots of alcohol. And cloying too. Interesting aroma, okay taste but fun to try beer! (Sampler from bottle shared at Borefts 2014)

Veggie spicy sweet malt aroma. Pours dark copper amber with a light tan thick foamy head that leaves a thick coating in the sides of the glass. Smooth with an edge on the finish. Sweet. Spice. Lots of cinnamon. Lots of pumpkin. Lingering warmth on the back of the tongue. This is a delicious beer that has a great balance between pumpkin spice, actual pumpkin flavor, legit beer flavor, and booziness.

I like that breweries are taken their beers to new levels by barrel or oak aging their inventory. Uinta has been putting extremely challenging beers as of late and this one is no exception. The aroma of booze is rampant. It has an orangy hue. The head is luscious and abundant. At first drink their is a pumpkin sensibility but the hops are overwhelming. The booziness is subtle until the wash down. A really good beer but I think I like the idea than in its execution. A bomber meant to be shared with good company. Still worth a whirl.

On tap 5 oz. pour at Max's in the Fell's Point district, Baltimore, MD. 

Clear, dark amber with an off-white head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of huge pumpkin fruit, spice cake and caramel. 

Taste of amped up pumpkin pie, spice cake (with cloves, cinnamon and nutmeg), alcohol, toffee and oak. 

Full/medium body and medium/high carbonation. 

Nothing subtle in this over-the-top imperial pumpkin with aggressively robust aroma and flavor. Good in small quantities, but I don't think I'd want more than a 10 ounce pour.

On tap at bier thirty. Pours out a dark amber topped with a sand head. Nose is pumpkin spice not over the top some vanilla and sweet malts. Taste is as the nose with a nice non fake pumpkin and light vanilla taste. I am glad I found this on tap and didnt have to buy a big bottle.

"A delicious if overpriced rich and smooth pumpkin ale. Smells of real pumpkin, not just spices, though they are nice as well. Oak imparts a little flavOr and a bit of smoothness to this rich beer. Creamy full body was the beers strength, but $14 is a bit much..."

This pours a dark amber brown color with a foamy beige head. The aroma is fairly bold with hints of pumpkin and spice. The taste is heavy and bold. The barrel aging really adds depth and complexity. The oak flavors really shine thru in the taste. Definitely worth a try.
UPDATED: SEP 6, 2014 Pretty great pumpkin beer, lots of good flavors. You can tell it?s a + 10% beer but it?s still very drinkable. Really enjoy the oak flavors. I?m drinking the Fall 2014 release.

 other notes  Pleasant but not extraordinary.

Pours a four finger off-white head that fades slowly some lace. Deep amber color. Medium carbonation and medium bodied. Nutmeg, clove and cinnamon nose and flavor is pumpkin pie on steroids, oak is noticeable, high ABV is not. Nice imperial pumpkin. Pricey at $13.99 for a 750ml bottle from Julios Liquors Westborough, Ma.

Poured from a bottle. Dark caramel color, medium white head. Mild pumpkin aroma. Medium body with a medium pumpkin flavor with a nice finish.

Poured from a bottle. No head but a nice orange reminds me of fall. Sweet fruity aroma, vanilla notes, not enough spiciness; terrific creaminess and very smooth going down.

Amazing aroma of pumpkin pie, allspice, cinnamon, an a trace of nutmeg. Orange color with a short lasting off white well laced head. Great taste of pumpkin and spice with a creamy feel and spicy finish.
Pours a reddish orange color with off-white head. Pumpkin, oak, pumpkin pie spices, vanilla, and bourbon on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with some barrel.

Bottle from Hop City. Pours a reddish amber with thin spotty beige colored head. Aroma of pumpkin and spice, almost like liquid pumpkin pie. Taste is pretty oaky, the abv definitely shows, with the pumpkin and spice on the back burner.

(Midwest ale train recollected in abstinence) Tap @Jack of the Wood, Asheville 1909/2012. Actually do not remember too much about this, apart from it being on my tab, spicy, savoury, with a musty sweetness and a healthy potency that did not detract from my even more potent Bison burger savoury flavours. Always up for late autumn revisitings, when forced.
Wow, first sip was very boozy, showing the 10% abv. Dark reddish amber, good flavor but mostly spice. Oak flavor is mild, which I like. This one grew on me as I worked through the bottle.

Bottle purchased at Ale Wine & Spirits in Powell. Clear copper pour with a huge tan head. Aroma of malt, cinnamon, ginger and oak. Malty flavor with big cinnamon and ginger before a warming finish with slight oak.

Heavy aromas of allspice - nutmeg, cinnamon -, notes of alcoholic ginger beer, and subtle pumpkin. Cherry-bronze with a fully lasting puffy off-white head. Off-dry, very vegetative, savory, with notes redolent of a damp forest. Full bodied, smooth, warming but not over the top.

Strong scents of spices especially cinnamon and ginger and malty oakness. Strong light beige head and hazy brown orange body. Tastes of cinnamon minor fruits and some oak shoe notes. Smooth and a little tart.
Aroma is pumpkins, spices, barrel aging/fruit and slight mustiness. The flavor is pumpkins, spices, fruit/berries, very slight heat and a mix of alcohol and tangy in the finish.
Dark red to brownish. Very oaky jack Daniels flavor with caramel notes. Somewhat light carbonation. Pretty enjoyable brew....
A big pumpkin and spice beer. The bourbon notes blend in pretty nicely but the oakiness seems a little out of place.
A big beer, with a pumpkin finish. Dark coloured malt liquour. Cinammon and umpkin spices. Lacy. Some sourness in the finish, and carbonation still there.

Deep mahogany color, burgundy tones with tan head, moderate retention. Bourbon, vanilla, pumpkin.. The flavor is deep, dark sugar and pumpkin. The spice seems fairly muted, or at least blends well with the high abv. Reminiscent of a dubbel, but with a bit of vegetal tone. Fairly syrupy. Big brew.

12/24/13. 750mL bottle from the Milan Hy Vee. Stereotypical pumpkin beer aroma, lots of spice, nutmeg, cinnamon, etc., with touches of oak and sweetness. Stereotypical flavor as well, slightly sweet, barely a touch of oak, lots of pie spices. Not awful, but just another pumpkin beer.

Bottle shared by drowland at xmas, pours a dark orange kind of brown with an off white head, the aroma was of tons of spice and cinnamon with a little bit of the vanilla from the barrel coming through, the flavor is much of the same with a good kick of spice on the front end and caramel and sweetness in the finish, the spice isnt overpowering through, nice.
Backlog bottle thanks to so many good ratebeerians. The smell is pumpkin, spice, leaves, and ok. The taste is pumpkin, sweet, whiskey, big, and spice. The look is orange to amber in color.

750 ml bottle

A strong entry in the Halloween seasonal department leaves a big mark. This might be the nicest Crooked Line beer I have tried although I have a few more on deck. A heady release is best split with friends or consumed over a long evening thanks to a high gravity.

Aroma / Appearance - The warm hue has the color of melted caramel drizzled under a lush head of ivory. Caramel, honey, cool squash, and a splash of oak brighten the air with the smell of a fall festival or a garden after the morning dew has evaporated.

Flavor / Palate - Spicy pumpkin rolls cling to the tongue after just two sips. Cream cheese and nutmeg follow before it morphs into a warm sweet finish. The barrel aging is evident but does not dominate; this is primarily a squash bomb in liquid form. By the end it becomes sticky. Overall though the strengths outweigh the weaknesses resulting in a very nice seasonal.

Bottle. Poured clear dark orange color with a large off-white frothy head that was mostly lasting with excellent lacing. Solid pumpkin spice aroma. Medium body with a creamy texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy balanced pumpkin spice flavor with a medium spice sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Good seasonal beer.

Got this bottle in a trade last year with Boltz7555, thanks Jason! Bottled on date of 08/24/2012. Dark brown color bordering on mahogany wood color. Very thin head, light lace in the tulip glass. Aroma is mostly barrel oak with traces of pumpkin underneath. Nice light nuances of bourbon and vanilla. Flavor of oak and vanilla upfront with an almost Coke a cola-caramel element. The barrel has totally subdued the pumpkin at this point. Lots of oak notes.The ABV is completely hidden in this right now, it barley displays any alcohol heat after the sip. Extremely light notes of sweet bourbon in the finish. Nice sipper!

A nose of cinimon and allspice with suggestins of oak. A clear dark amber pour that when held to the light takes on a glowing garnet hue. A foamy tan head with modate retention leaves behind spotty lacing. On the tongue, the spices and woodiness dominate, while hints of alcohol appear briefly in the finish. Medium body and crisp carbonation. Somewhat of a slick mouthfeel. Overall, an enjoyable seasonal brew, but I found it disappointing that the PUMPKIN was lost in the mix of spice, oak, and alcohol.

750 ml caged and corked bottle, bottled on 09/18/13. Served in a nonic pint glass, the beer pours a mostly clear reddish/orange color with about an inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both good. Aroma is nice, the brew smells mostly like pumpkin and pumpkin spices, along with some light vanilla and oak. It tastes like pumpkin spices (cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice), pumpkin, vanilla, oak, and a bit of booze and butterscotch. Its not an overspiced pumpkin beer, so in this case it helps the brew. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its chewy and coating with a good amount of carbonation. I think its a good pumpkin ale, Id try it again in the future. $11.99 a bottle.
Big bouteille. Orange brown clear. Bubbles and lacing. Spiced and pumpkin nose. Pumpkin, spice hints of yeast and hops. Pretty good.

750mL bottle, cool artwork. Pours a deep amber-brown, medium off-white head with okay retention and nice lacing. Nose is kinda off-putting -- unlike beers such as S.T.s Pumking and Warlock or Hoppin Frogs Double Barrel pumpkin ale, the pumpkin and spice notes are overridden by something that reminds me of acrylic lacquer (like the wifes nail polish). Thankfully, this tastes a whole lot better than the nose indicates... big body, roasted pumpkin and pie spice up front (lotta nutmeg and I think thats allspice Im tasting), toasty malt hiding in the background, some cidery notes but covered up by a medium sweetness, slight hint of the barrel and a bit warm on the finish. Overall, not a bad beer, and quite suitable for a raw, late Novembers eve with snow in the Chicago forecast.

Bottle to glass. Sweet label. Pours a deep amber color with a small light brown head. Sweet pumpkin spice aroma with definite hints of oak. Flavor is a nice mix of pumpkin, spice, oak, and even a mild sour. Light to medium in body. Delicious.

750 corked n caged bottle- Pours hazy dark red with a three finger head. Aroma is pumpkin, cinnamon and nutmeg, oak, there is a sweet candy like aroma, licorice or something, vanilla, very nice. The taste is surprising, it tastes Belgian, almost like a sour, I think some bugs got in there! There is pumpkin, subtle oak which in my opinion could have been more prominent, vanilla, cherry, bourbon. Body is medium and carbonation is high. Great beer, a sipper, but very tasty!

Poured from big bottle. Aroma of pumpkin, spice, brown sugar. Good lookin clear mahogany with big lacing head. Pumpkin flavor leads with nutmeg, cinnamon, brown sugar, vanilla, alcohol right behind. Long story short - very much like ST Pumking, with higher alcohol, which complements the flavor and warms the belly. Well done.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Dark red color with a large head. Aroma of cloves and pumpkin. Initially a light vanilla flavor. Warms into a full malt and pumpkin canvas with moderate nutmeg and allspice. Quite nice.

Surprisingly drinkable given the ABV. Aroma of vanilla and pumpkin pie spices. The oak barrel comes through strong with vanilla and bourbon flavors. Delicious pumpkin beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 750 ml bottle. Pours a wonderful ruby brown color, with a finger of off white creamy head. Fall spices on the nose, complimented by a nice malt character and a hint of oak. The oak flavor jumps out first, and the spices some into play next, I love that they arent overwhelming. The malt on the finish is nice. A very well crafted beer.

From the corked caged 750 ml. bottle. The pour is a beautiful looking deep amber tone with red hues as opposed to orange, which frequently accompany pumpkins. Moderate long lasting beige head. The aroma is not so much pumpkin spices as it is dark malts, black licorice, butterscotch, and a touch of booze. The body is medium to bold. The taste brings out those pumpkin spices more so than the aroma but it does have some punch so the beer goes right to my dizzy head. Moderate finish.

Of the pumpkin beers, Id say ST Pumking still beats this one by a wide margin. That said, this is still solid and the oak aging complements nicely with the spicy beer. You pick up the bourbon/vanilla easily. A sipper.
Smells delicious. I get pumpkin, cinnamon, and some cherries? Cloves and pumpkin spice are all coming through. Some slight bourbon in the after taste.

Poured a dark red clear color with a large creamy head. Arima of pumpkin and cherries. Lots of big yeast notes like a belgian quad. Taste is very flavorful with pumpkin and berries. Nice hop flavors balance it out. Not too syrupy and the alcohol is hidden well.

750 ml corked and caged bottle. Aroma consists of pie spices, lemon, vanilla. Pours hazy amber with a large beige head with excellent retention; leaves decorative lace. Taste is sweet and savory with licorice, spice and oak flavors, light booze. Slightly foamy mouthfeel, medium body. Pretty good, but I was hoping for more with this one.

750mL bottle, pours a dark amber with a medium beige head. Aroma of pumpkin spices and wood. Flavour brings out oak barrels, pumpkin spices, and a bit of alcohol. Quite a bit more potent than the average pumpkin beer, along with woody notes. Very well-blended, fairly spicy, and oaky. Really good stuff.

Definite wood and vanilla notes in the aroma along with subtle spices. Crystal clear amber orange with a voluminous light tan head. Rich caramel flavor and sweetness followed by a nice alcohol bite and then vegetal pumpkin flavor with spices. The oak aging really kicks in in the aftertaste along with a bourbon-like flavor (not sure if its actually bourbon or the toasted oak with all the alcohol floating around here). Finishes fairly hot with lasting toasted wood and vanilla/caramel tastes. Really nice Imperial pumpkin ale.

Not a whole lot of boozy barrel which is great, not real spicy which is also good. A dark orange lots of effervescence, lightly creamy feel, sustained head. good head retention. medium-full to very full aroma. real balance of maillard, nutmeg, vanilla, booze, fresh pumpkin. a bit hot on the end but otherwise very solid and expertly done.

Pours a lovely deep amber brown with a beige head. Has a lovely aroma of malt spice and a hint of caramel from the oak. Tastes a little sweet with the pumpkin and spice but then I get a full malt taste that is almost overpowering. Goes down easy but leaves me with the sweet malt taste.

Pours a deep amber color with a three finger fizzy eggshell foam. The nose has a trace of melted plastic, sweet malts, vanilla and a touch of pumpkin. The palate hides the off notes in the nose a bit more... but its still detectable in trace amounts. The beer otherwise is well balanced and a nice blend of boozy bourbon flavors of vanilla, creme brulee, brown sugar and pumpkin. Traces of fig and dates round out the palate and there is some bitterness and a touch of metallic flavor on the finish.

750 mL bottle from Whole Foods Paramus, just a bit over a year old. Drinking to celebrate Halloween, as 2 in the morning is about the last chance Im going to have today. Pours a dark, murky orange-brown color with a medium sized fizzy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of chocolate, wood, whiskey, pumpkin. The taste is bourbon, wood, green apple, pumpkin, toasted malts, mild spice. Almost reminiscent of a mulled cider in some respects. Medium bodied, low carbonation, a mild bit of tartness, medium bodied.
Bottle sampled at Kryptonite. From notes. Pumpkin and pumpkin pie spices. vanilla and oak with a hint of bourbon. Boozy, but less than expected. Very very good.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours brown/copper with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of light oak, some pumpkin, lightly roasted malts, a little chocolate and spices, some vanilla, and light bitterness. Flavor the same with a good blend of it all. Average to smooth texture. A pretty good pumpkin beer.

Aroma: Vanilla, Pumpkin, Mild Oakey

Appearance: Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Some Lacing

Taste: Vanilla, Pumpkin, Mild Allspice, Mildly Oakey

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Spicy

750 ml bottle shared with the wife. Pours a clear dark mahogany color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet pumpkin with a nice balance of spices, oak, very subtle bourbon notes, vanilla, mildly toasted malts and caramel. Too drinkable for the abv. Solid drinking pumpkin beer.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a mostly transparent deep amberish brown with fluffy light beige head. Smells of pumpkin and spices with a fairly sweet backbone; much like pumpkin pie. Tastes like it smells with an oak presence as well. Pleasant on the palate. A good pumkin beer that is dangerously drinkable!

750, corked and baled. Pours a murky dark rubied amber with a dense and fizzy light tan head. Big boozy nose, fairly sharp, showing cardamom and nutmeg and oak. Creamy body on the light side of medium, fizzy carb. Hot pie spices on the mid palate, lots of biting sharp wood, and then a somewhat boozy finish.
750ml split with wife pours amber with a silky off white creamy colored head that leaves a light lacing coat. light cinnamon, nutmeg, light caramel. big effort from oak and booze. body is burly.

750ml bottle, shared with friends. Mostly clear dark red color. Great bigger off-white head. Decent rows of lace. Nice oaky pumpkin, spice nose. Good hearty pumpkin, spice flavors. Hint of chocolate. Moderate bitter taste, sort of a spicy finish. Alsohol is not bothersome, though, no burn nor bite. Bigger body. Smooth, lighter, sort of crisp carbonation. Solid imperial pumpkin ale. Very smooth and easy drinking for the high ABV. Not at all boozy. Not too sweet like pumking, more on the bitter side, but I like it still. Good, in its own different way.

Aromas of cinnamon and pumpkin, and lots of booze. A little oak. Nice color of mahogany. In truth, a little underwhelming for the price. Not near as much pumpkin flavor as I'd hoped. Needs to be to temp before flavors really come out

Leave your pretensions at the door.
excellent!!! On the the best this year. aroma is rich with spice. The appearance is dark. Taste incredible the vanilla and bourbon. would like buy a case but cant little pricey

Dark reddish brown color, moderate head, good lace/retention. Aroma is pumpkin, nutmeg, oak, vanilla, caramel. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel, alcohol is readily detectable. Chewy with caramel and malt sweetness, but also has the pumpkin and barrel flavors youd expect to see.

Sample @ GABF.
Pours a medium amber, with a beige head.
Spicy, oaky, fruity aroma, caramel, cinnamon.
Semi-sweet, full bodied, mid to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Fruity, spicy taste, caramel, malt, oak, vanilla, cinnamon.
(2013-10-10)

Pours a dark amber with a tan head leaving heavy lacing. Aromas of spice and pumkin. Tastes of fall spices like cumin and some cinnamon with some hoppy notes. Heavier mouthfeel for a lighter colored imperial barrel aging comes through with an alcohol warmth.

Aroma has hint of pumpkin and spice. Light brown pour small off white head. Taste is complex. Little pumpkin but oak agging is visible. Thicker chewy mouthfeel than most imperial stout pumpkins. Very good. Alcohol comes out at end.
Im done with pumpkin beers. None of the dozens that Ive tasted this year have been any good.

Bottle to glass. Dark mahogany body with a thick khaki head that eventually settles. Nose is spice, pumpkin, some vanilla, oak, Bourbon. Nice; interestingly natural pumpkin notes. Taste is a lot of oaked pumpkin and spices up front. The booziness is quite present, with a long ripe pumpkin finish. Hard to compare it to the other pumpkin beer giant I wont name, but this is much better than most beers of this style.
a fairly decent variation on the style, though nothing special really about it. much better than most of the mass marketed craft pumpkin ales out there though.

Whoa, big beer! Poured slightly warm with a giant tan, slow to settle, thick, foamy head and good lacing. Color is a clear, deep amber with few bubble trails. Aroma is oaked pumpkin, malt, spice, hops. Flavors like nose with everything much more bold. Sweet and tang are out front and bitter brings up a strong, long lasting end. Body is full round, alcohol warm with just enough bitter to keep it interesting. Finish is like flavor and as stated above. Rich, so one big bottle is plenty.

Location: 750 ml bottle from State Line, 9/15/13


Aroma: The nose is sweet malts, spice, and booze, not super pumpkiny/nutmegy 

Appearance: It pours a nice mahagony color with a beige head and medium lacework

Flavor: The taste is spice and sweetness, oak, a little booze, pumpkin come through more

Palate: The body s medium-full, mild heat, smooth and creamy, drinks nicely for 10+ ABV

Overall Impression: 
I have had this one for a few months, and it is drinking quite nicely right now. The oak and spice meld excellently together for a smooth, enjoyable flavor. Id recommend this one for sure.   Tasty stuff.

Pours a deep brown/red color with a two finger khaki head. Smells of basically pumpkin pie, spices, caramel, pumpkin. Taste pretty much the same but a bit mellowed out by the bourbon oak barrel. Alcohol is present at the end of each sip, in a good way. Enjoyable beer

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 9/6/2012. Pours lightly hazy deep ruby red color with a 1-2 finger dense light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of huge caramel, toffee, pumpkin, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg, toast, brown sugar, gingerbread, oak, vanilla, bourbon, light chocolate, light roast, and toasted earthiness. Incredible aromas with great balance and complexity of malt, spice, pumpkin, and barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big caramel, toffee, pumpkin, cinnamon, clove, nutmeg, toast, brown sugar, gingerbread, oak, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, and toasted earthiness. Lingering notes of caramel, toffee, pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, toast, brown sugar, gingerbread, oak, bourbon, vanilla, light chocolate, and toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity of malt, pumpkin, spice, and barrel flavors; with a near perfect balance of all flavors and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a moderately creamy, slick, and slightly syrupy mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic barrel aged pumpkin ale! All around awesome balance and complexity of malt, spice, pumpkin, and barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle to pint glass
Aroma of pumpkin, vanilla, oak, and cherry. A deep red colour with a creamy yellowish tan head with nice lacing. The taste is heavy pumpkin, toasted malt, nutmeg, mace, and alcohol. This is full bodied, creamy, well balanced with a nice alcohol burn.

I wasnt too thrilled with this beer at first, but the more I kept taking sips, the more I was liking it. I was expecting a lot of pumpkin flavor in this beer, but I dont really taste it all that much. I find the flavors from the oak barrel aging dominates the profile. I taste a lot of oak, alcohol, sweet malts and even a touch of vanilla. The beer leaves an autumn/winter-like feeling of warmness. The nose is quite rich, as well, with notes of sweet malt, alcohol, pumpkin, cinnamon and a touch of nutmeg. The beer finishes warm and a little spicy with cinnamon, nutmeg and some floral hops.

Thanks to ericandersnavy for sharing this at bu11zeyes 10,000th tasting in April 2012. Orange with a tan head. The aroma has a ton of oak, pumpkin and spice notes in it. The flavor is similar. I get a lot of cinnamon, clove and nutmeg notes with some pumpkin and oak thrown in. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
1 year old almost bottle shared the other night. Not too boozy, very much like pumkin pie, far less sweet than otehr examples.
Rated in April 2012 (Backlog) - Amber orange in color with an average sized off-white head. Aroma is of pumpkin, squash and earth. Taste is of eart, leaves, pumpkin and malt.

Bottle from Brusin ales aged at least a year - pours a dark clear ruby red with a tan head. Aroma is pumpkin pie, nutmeg, vanilla, malt, booze. Taste is sweet from the pumpkin with a dry sourness in the finish. Nice!

A very nice pumpkin ale. Pours a dark maroon color with a thick tan head. Smells awesome, like spicy pumpkin pie. Taste is smokey, spicy and a little boozy. Sweet finish. Had in the bottle.

Have had a few times.  Always remember enjoying this one as well, wishing there was more.  Lots of spiced flavors here: nutmeg, cinnamon, vanilla...blending well with a bourbony pumpkin note.  Caramel and oak for a lovely finish.  Great beer.

A - Dark copper-red color with a finger of frothy khaki-tan head. Fades normal.

S - Sweet caramel and dark caramel malts, oak, vanilla, pumpkin, brown sugar, dark fruits, cloves, cinnamon, and some other spices, a bit of booze.

T - Sweet caramel and dark caramel malts, pumpkin, oak, vanilla, brown sugar, clove, cinnamon, nutmeg, other spices, raisins and other dark fruits, and a bit of booze.

M - Medium-full bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a sweet, warming, and lightly spicy finish.

D - Great barrel aged pumpkin ale. Nice blend of spices.

THOUGHTS: A very different take on a pumpkin beer. Very elegant. And rare for a pumpkin beer, itll probably age well. Lots of bourbon and wood with just enough pumpkin and spice. Sour flavors also popped up from time to time to make it even more interesting. Hid alcohol fairly well. Bonus point for the Halloween marketing.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a clear, dark amber with an average to large, off-white head that kept a thin sheet and left good lacing. The aroma had moderate caramel; wood; oak; bourbon; and pumpkin pie spices. The initial flavor was moderately sweet, lightly sour and slightly acidic; while the finish was heavily sweet, slightly sour and lightly bitter and acidic with an average duration. There was caramel, fruity pumpkin, slightly sour pumpkin, pumpkin pie spices, bourbon, wood, oak, alcohol, and pumpkin pie. The medium body was fairly creamy, but sticky on the lips and then dry with fizzy carbonation and lightly alcoholic and ever so slightly chalky finish.

Another superb pumpkin ale, but not quite at the level of Southern Tier. More of a traditional barrel-aged ale, but with pumpkin influences. Dark pour, with pumpkin spiced scent. Absolutely solid malty base, with nutmeg, cinnamon and pumpkin notes, with lingering spiciness. Has a nice sweetness, perhaps from the aging? This is a big, bold beer that I quite like. It's a sipping beer for sure, and non-beer geeks may not appreciate the complexity that this one has that is lacking in the nevertheless goodness of Southern Tier's pumpkin ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a bottle. Smells delicious like pumpkin pie and cinnamon. The taste is crisp, slightly bitter, very earthy.

Bottle. Pours dark, clear amber with average, creamy off-white head; decent retention and lacing. Aroma is pumpkin, vanilla, bourbon, floral hops, plums, cinnamon, and spice. Flavor is sweet malts forward with supporting oak, bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar, pumpkin and other dark fruit esters, and light floral hops; dry, lightly sweet finish. Medium body and low carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark amber with a moderate light tan head. Nose is quite pumpkiny with a malty backbone. Taste is also malty with caramel flavors subtly in play. Interesting brew, especially given that Im not a huge pumpkin person.
Dont like pumpkin beer...pumpkin beer thats oaked?  eh, not so bad.  This is a BIG beer, its sweet, but the oak helps to balance it and the pumpkin and spice isnt too strong.

Bottle. Pours a clear amber with a light brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a light spice note with some brown sugar, pumpkin and a bit of vanilla from the barrel. Flavor starts with light spice and has a bit of barrel which is joined by a nice pumpkin finish.

One of the best pumpkin beers. Taste of pumpkin and brown sugar. Spices come through nicely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Might be the last pumpkin beer of the season, and what a way to finish. Pumpkin brew at its finest, seriously. Rich color, sweet aroma and strong gourdy flavor that gets you jacked up for more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice deep copper color with off white sudsy head.  Light boozey pumpkiny-woody aroma.  Full bodied pumpkin flavors, spiced with woody notes and a touch of booze in the finish.  Really a great pumpkin beer.

Pours a dark amber into the glass, with a light cap that leaves mild lacing. Aromas of banana bread, pumpkin meat and spices. Malty and deeply spiced, there are pumpkin flavors alongside ginger, Allspice and cinnamon. The spices play well with the ABV, providing an oily mouthfeel and full, slick body. I think this works very well for an Impy Pumpkin Ale. Satiating and bold, Goes down well on a very cold winter's night.
What I like most about this beer is it not just spices. To many pumpkin beer are more spice then pumpkin or beer. This beer is well balanced and the oak and bourbon notes are a nice change.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 750ml corked bottle, 2013 vintage aged in J&K Liquors cellar. The aging really improved this one. Oak and vanilla aroma with notes of pumpkin and a hint of spice. Pours dark amber colored tinged with orange as well as one finger of tan head and excellent lacing. Starts with excellent pumpkin and spice flavors, most notably nutmeg and cinnamon. Finishes smooth with vanilla and oak flavors with a touch of booze. The aging really brought out all of the flavors in this one. Wonderful!

12/31/12: Aroma is oak and bourbon. Pours dark amber color. Strong oak and bourbon with notes of pumpkin.

750ml bottle.
Dull amber brew with some off-white head.  Aromas of pumpkin, spices, some vanilla - lacking overall.  Flavor is pumpkin, cinnamon and other spices.  Didnt get much oak out of this one.

750ml bottle - $13.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Bottled on: 09/04/12

Appearance: Pours out a clear, deep, dark amber-hued body with a tall, foamy, yellowed head. Thin blips of sticky lacing on the way down.

Smell: Sweet-scented (but doesnt imply as much sweetness as comes across in the flavor) caramel, brown sugar, and coagulated dark amber honey. Toasty, crusty remnants. Squashy vegetal tones. Moderate spiciness. Vanilla, oak, and all the bourbon aromas youd hope for.

Taste: Sweet, sugary tastes of caramel, cooked honey, light-colored brown sugar and plenty of toasted pumpkin. Also, toasted pie crust accents. Pumpkin pie spicing thats exacerbated by the punchy alcohol. Vanilla and stern, angry-faced oak wood along with the strong bourbony flavor (I know, it says only oak, but it feels bourbony to me) letting loose a strong wave of alcohol warmth. Speaking of warmth, giving it some time to open up helps this one, either that or the alcohol is just kicking in and making me a bit more agreeable. Candyish, spicy, boozy finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-full body. Medium carbonation.

Overall: I decided to take on this 750ml all by myself, just to make sure I had enough. WAIT I RAN OUT ALREADY. Its fairly good, but I would still lean toward Pumking, as this came across as a wee bit hot for me.
Sampled at an esbls tasting.  A nice red brown hue.  A decent layer of tan foam.  I smell wood and pumpkin.  Pumpkin, cinnamon, wood, and fall spices are tasted.  Pretty good stuff.

Bottle. Pours clear reddish amber with a medium orange-tan head that slowly dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma has that telltale pumpkin ale note, with allspice, cinnamon, bit of clove. Flavor is the same, lightly sweet, lightly bitter, notes of wood. Body is medium, carbonation is medium. Light astringence in the mouth, but that fades after a few minutes of sitting. Well balanced, not overpowering in the spice notes like so many pumpkin ales. ABV very well masked. Nice beer

Murky copper, huge white head. Smells like roasted pumpkin, cinnamon, plus some rum and oak notes. Taste is nicely sweet, with molasses ans rum, plus some woody flavors, too. Hints of pumpkin and spice, as well.

Most everybody else at Thanksgiving wasnt a fan, but I was pleased that the pumpkin flavor was manageable and that the oak was noticeable. Also, the oak flavors overpowered the alcohol so it didnt seem that strong to me.

Bottle. Hop and hints of oak in the nose. Dark brown with a good sized tan head. Reall nice, sweet flavor with plenty of alcohol strength and moderately hopped. Pumpkin flavor pervasive, melding with the alcohol. Oak notes and pumpkin work beautifully.

Pours ruby red with a light head. The aroma is what you would expect from an oaked beer and is nice in that respect. Theres a lot of bourbon flavor in here and a lot of vanilla. The malt doesnt stand up to it here. Theres prominent spicing but I cant distinguish any one in particular. The pumpkin gets a little lost after the first pint which is a shame because it is well balanced at the beginning and it worked with the sweetness well. Its a good pumpkin offering but not my favorite from Uinta.

Bottle from Julios. Pours out a deep reddish brown with a big frothy tan head. Strong sweet spicy aroma. Somewhat earthy. Flavor is big and roasty, oak is kept in check. Very smooth and easy drinking. Alcohol nose is slight. Big and chewy finish. Not an everyday drinker, but definately worth a try.

excellent ruby brown color, with a finger of off white creamy head. Fall spices on the nose, complimented by a nice malt character and a hint of oak. The oak flavor jumps out first, and the spices some into play next, I love that they arent overwhelming. The malt on the finish is nice. A very well crafted beer.

Bottle.  Pours a fairly clear dark ruby amber with a medium to large seized deep beige head.  Pumpkin, soft spices, a touch of oak on the nose, sweet pumpkin and caramel.  Medium bodied, big and warming, spicy malt and pie spices, a touch of pumpkin.  Moves into some sweet boozy plum and prune notes, more malt and a light amount of spice.  Warming alcohol into the finish.  Tasty.
From a corked and caged bottle. One of my all-time favorite pumpkin beers, and I really enjoy pumpkin beers. The addition of oak aging really brings out the pumpkin pie flavors.

Bottle. Dark amber with off white head. Quite a musty and dusty aroma, spicy pumpkin as well, lots of toffee. Taste is toffee, biscuit, spiced pumpkin and a little wood. A little sweet and cloying. Ok

In bottle at Craigs. Pours a very dark amber colour with a fair beige head. Aroma of vanilla, cloves, ginger, pumpkin and caramel. Similar flavours with mild carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Lovely with lingering puff candy, pumpkin and alcohol again.
bottle at home ... copper ... thin white head ... soft roast ... light pumpkin nose ... soft sweet fruits ... very sweetie ... juicy fruits .. light floral ... got a flavour of some spangles...

75 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden amber with a small off white head. Aroma is roasted malty and light breadish. Light spiced. Toffee malty, bitter, caramelish and light nutmeg spiced. Sweet and roasted malty. Bitter and medium dry finish.

Best pumpkin beer by me.

Has a strong pumpkin spice aroma, but more interestingly has a rich herbal, almost vegetable, character. The oak is not nearly as present as I would have liked, but the beer is a complete success.

750mL thanks to noodleuser. Pours a clear deeper ruby looking deep red amber in the glass with a larger, dense, thick, yellow head. Excellent retention and sticky patches of lace. Nose at first is typical pumpkin pie, candied yams, brown sugar. A little syrupy sweet in profile. Taste is richer, smoother, quite palatable with mild candied yams, small pumpkin pie spice. Decent stuff. Nothing to write home about. Good Gourd....now that is something to write home about.

Sampled at the DC gathering at GTs place. Clear dark burnt orange pour fair offwhite head.  Pretty decent underlying pumpkin beer, but and the oak is largely pronounced, but in a balanced fashion. I guess I just dont care for this one too much.  But I can tell it is well made. I think I would have liked this better as just the base beer.  Cool abv nod.

Bottle shared by noodleuser.  Pours clear copper with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium-short retention with light lacing.  Aroma is pumpkin, spices, pie crust, and light alcohol.  Flavor is pumpkin and spices, medium crust malt and heavy sweetness.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation.
Bottle courtesy of noodleuser, thanks!  Beautiful ruby amber color, small beige head. Aroma of appropriate spice. Taste is gourd more than spice. Not usually my cup of tea, but this one is tasty.

750ml cork and cage.  Pours a dark amber/ brown color. Plenty of roasted pumpkin in the aroma, pie crust, and burnt sugars. Smells and tastes of gourd, bourbon barrel and wood.  A solid pumpkin beer, my first imperial pumpkin and the 10 percent is disguised very well.  Full bodied and creamy mouthfeel.

My first reaction was, " Wow.  This isnt the best pumpkin beer ive had, its the best beer ive had in a while."  Gorgeous ruby colored pour with a beige two-finger head.  Pumpkin aroma with nutmeg, cinnamon, and cardamom.  Taste is pumpkin, a nice balanced malt/hop profile, perfume, and booze without being overly boozy.  The pumpkin flavor stands out without being overshadowed by spices.  Full bodied in the mouth.  A great beer.

Bottle: &nbsp Copper colored, ruby hues, moderate to large frothy off-white head, fairly sticky lacing. &nbsp Soft oak up front, otherwise some moderately spiced nutmeg and cinnamon that follow. &nbsp A smattering of oak, vanilla, bourbon, nutmeg, cinnamon, and pumpkin pie on the tongue. &nbsp The 10.3% ABV seems very well hidden. &nbsp Everything seems to be in moderation, nothing stands out as being dominant. &nbsp This is just as much as a barrel aged beer as it is a pumpkin beer. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel. &nbsp This one feels pretty hefty. &nbsp The one thing I like about this is that it doesnt seem artificial. &nbsp Nice body, flavorful, long lasting, with a unique barrel aged twist. &nbsp One of the better Pumpkin Ales out there. &nbsp Thanks for the bottle Turd!

750 c&c from The Davis Beer Shoppe in Davis, CA. Pours ruddy copper with a fizzy, disappearing beige head. Aromas of pies spice and vanilla/bourbon. Full bodied. Theres a good amount of pie spice and when that leaves theres oak/vanilla/bourbon. This is an exceptionally good ale. Woot!
Caramel nose; pours a beautiful ruby-brown.  The oak overwhelms most of the pumpkin & spice notes, but with the sweet, malty alcohol backing it is a nice combination nevertheless.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2012 Ok beer.  Nice appearance brownish orange color clear with no head.  The aroma is sweet with hints of all spice and a little Carmel.  Taste is Slightly sweet Carmel, spice, and a small amount of dry wood finish that ends a little bitter.

Hazy dark amber pour. Plenty of roasted pumpkin in the aroma, pie crust, and burnt sugars. Flavor is solid. Plenty of gourd, bourbon barrel and wood. A bit of booty bourbon. This is not your normal spiced pumpkin brew. This is the real thing. Full bodied and creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle.  Pours a a glistening dark amber.  The top stays adequately covered in a thin sheet of grayish tan suds.  The nose has sweet caramelized sugar tones, pumpkin pie spice notes, boozy alcohol, and a dryish oak edging.  Flavors are mellow and smooth, with firm sweetness, firm but relaxing boozy power, oaky vanilla mellowed spice and pumpkin character...decent, like a pumpkin & spice laced amber ale with a lot of alcohol, pretty big sweetness, and an oaky feel.

Big spicy Orange hazy pumpkin ale.  Strong in alcohol and flavor the spices are interesting and the bourbon flavor is very light.  I was hoping for more.  Light with vanilla this beer could use more of certain spices and less of others.  More time in the barrels. Over all very tasty big beer.

750ml bottle.  Pours a light ruby brown with a big creamy off white head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is more subdued than expected - some pumpkin spices with some vegetal metallic notes.

The flavor is sweet chocolate malts with lots of spices and decent bitterness in the finish.  The alcohol is well hidden.  The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation.

Overall, an OK pumpkin.  Its subdued - even though its 10+%.  The spices seem a bit muddled and its overly sweet to my tastes.
Bottle/750ml - Poured a dark brown in color with a small tan head.  Aroma is fairly strong of pumpkin, vanilla/bourbon and pumpkin spices.  Flavor is pretty much the same and fairly sweet.  Nice...
Not the best I ever had. I would describe as a raw pumpkin that tasted alittle underdeveloped. super pumpkin and booze and not too much else for me.

Pours a dark brown with a big tan head. The aroma has toasted nuts, vanilla, pumpkin, some spices and booze. The flavor has the same with a nice roastiness to it. Not the pumpkin pie type, this has a nice touch. Not too sweet.

750ml bottle purchased at west lakeview. Fallfest with the wife!... Pours a deep mahogany, somewhat transparent, with more of a scotch ale type of resemblance and topped with a medium frothy light beige head that quickly recedes leaving a wispy film... Aroma consists of pumpkin oak and vanilla but to its detriment, a sharp metallic note is also present. Smewhat cola-ey as well with deeper caramel with noticeable carbonation it seems like... Flavors are sweet and malt forward with pumpkin notes combining with deeper, richer caramel toffee and vanilla oak tones. A somewhat bitter, slightly astrigent finish follows it all up. Carbonation is pretty lively and the body isnt as Davy as one would expect... The aroma really throws things off for me.
Bottle.  A brown amber color with a nice tan head.  A nicely spiced aroma of pumpkin, vanilla, bourbon and bananas.  It has a nice feel and smooth body with rich flavors, especially for pumpkin ales.

Bottle picked up at StateLine... Nice orange pour, decent head. Good head.... Sweet nose of oak, pumpkin, spices, bourbon.... Taste is the same.... You can tell this beer is aged in barrels... Lots of bourbon sweetness, pumpkin, spices.... Medium stick body. Overall: Good beer, unique. High alcohol is noticable but not over bearing....
Flavor of pumpkin, spices, vanilla and hints of oak.... Very rich and spicy flavor, very enjoyable beer... Very complex for a pumpkin beer...

750 ml corked and caged bottle shared with Doodler and company poured a clear orang amber withalasting amber head. Aromas of cinnamon, allspice, carmel and light oak. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of  carmel, cinnamon, allspice, light earthiess and a hint of oak with a smooth spiced finish.

Bottle shared with friends. So last year I opened up a BA pumpkin beer around the same time so I wanted to keep the tradition going this year. I love pumpkin beers but have never been blown away by a BA pumpkin, and this one was no different. Its a pretty good standard pumpkin beer but no real barrel presence in the  flavor/aroma. I suppose its just hard to barrel age a pumpkin beer.

Bottle @ home. Amber orange appearance with a creamy tan head. Spicy nutmeg, cinnamon, caramel malty, pumpkin aroma. Oak, spicy cinnamon, nutmeg, pumpkin, amber, vanilla, light bourbon, caramel malty flavor. Pretty spicy pumpkin brew.

Bottled on 09-11.  The beer pours a clear, ruby, mahogany color with an average, fizzy, beige head which is mostly diminishing and leaves minimal lace.  The nose is pleasant with plenty of pumpkin pie notes (rich caramel, nutmeg, mace, sweet pie crust), lots of toasted notes, vanilla, faint fresh thyme, and slight shaved oak.  The flavor starts very rich but balanced with lots of toasted caramel, sweet vanilla, significant nutmeg and cinnamon, a nice pumpkin flavor, and brown sugar but shaved oak filters in with a bourbon-like spice, and a faint coffee note.  The palate is medium to full, nearly lively, velvety, and round.  The beer finishes average for the ABV with toasted caramel still, some brown sugar, shaved oak lingering, and bourbon spice.  I loved the richness and the spicing, and the oak really rounded out the flavor.  The pumpkin notes were a bit overwhelming at times but the beer drank like a table strength beer.  Not usually a fan of pumpkin beers but the richness, balance, and round oak notes make for a nice beer.

Bottle @ The BeerMongers...  Poured deep, amber/reddish with an off-white head.  Noticeable spice, bit foamy and dry on the palate.  Hints of anise, nutmeg, cinnamon, but lots of squashy and roasted pumpkin flavors.  Nutty malt, caramel, and a clean easy going finish.

750mL corked and caged bottle from a trade with Gription79, bottled 09.07.2011.  Thanks man!  Pours clear bright ruby red and orange with a 2-finger yellow-tinged head; some webby lacing as the head recedes.  Aromas of sweet pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, sweet dough, and vanilla.  The flavor is sweet pumpkin and brown sugar, lightly buttered dough, and mild pie spices and alcohol.  The finish consists of light buttery oak, but not overpowering.  Medium carbonation and medium/full body, a little warming, and verging on creamy; this is surprisingly easy-drinking for the ABV.  Im enjoying this, its a really tasty seasonal.  Nice amounts of spice, not overpowered by the barrel treatment, and well done overall.  [823]

bottle for frickin $15, geez. weird brew, they should have just stuck it in a bourbon barrel. its still overrall a decent beer, just not quite what i hadf hoped. though it is uinta, so i will give them a break.

Bottle thanks to 17thfloor for sharing. Pours a deep amber with a small light beige froth. Aroma is nicely malty, rich bready pumpkin character with some strong spices, cinnamon, nutmeg, just a hint of woodiness. Flavor starts sweet with some vanilla, picking up the spices and some of the sweet bread. Finishes with a spiced cake character and a light bitterness, a touch of graininess that lingers. Medium to medium full body and a crisp carbonation. Nice beer the oak is very subtle on the classic pumpkin ales, flavor finishes just a bit poorly

Bottle.  Pours a somewhat flat, clear but dark murky looking, copper brown with a very small thin white head, might have poured like this due to the straight from the back of the fridge pouring temp.  Aroma is sweet pumpkin, with some nice toasty soft roasty hint of cocoa, has a really nice earthy, well integrated spice, pumpkin pie filling aroma that most other pumpkin beers dont have, round and full, maybe there are hints of bourbon and vanilla in there but they really just work to complement the pumpkin pie filling, nice nutmeg, nothing jumps out individually but they all work together for a singular aroma, some dates, raisins and cinnamon also.  Flavor isnt quite as interesting as the aroma, seemingly crystal malt and bitter black tea, some toasty bread, spicing leaves an odd bitterness, off-dry, really just tea like, pumpkin flavor is slight, more of a nutmeg and crystal malt thing with a seemingly hint of black malt or something sharply bitter.  Leaves a somewhat gross tannic bitterness on the lips after swallowing.  Palate is watery, very fine sizzling carbonation, very weak finish, nicely attenuated and the alcohol is very well hidden.  Really hard to get past this aftertaste.

750ml.  Nice maple pour with thin off white head and some lacing.  Nose is fairly typical pumpkin ale with the normal fall spices (nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, etc). Nose also has the hints of oak.  Taste follows the nose but is not overpowering on the spices.  Great buttery oak undertone with a nice warming finish.  This is a big time fall beer and the best I have had to date (albeit still September)

Bottle (bottled 8/26/11). First pumpkin beer of the season. Pours with a murky, deep bronze hued body and a pretty large, off-white, tan head. Close knit bubbles, creamy. Decent lace. Aromas of spice, a little bit of soggy grain/pumpkin vegital qualities, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, biscuity, corn bread, very mild oak notes, light esters. Really minimal, if any bourbon or alcohol (well hidden if there is some). Flavors of spice, lightly starchy vegital notes that finish sweet and a bit metallic. Molasses, oak, alcohol, tannic, short duration. Some cinnamon and light bready notes, a hint of coffee. Bitter, grassy, vegital in the finish. Lots of a soggy malt character. Its not quite DMS (although it is often coupled with it), and I sometimes refer to it as wet dog, but I sadly dont have a better descriptor. Shockingly lively carbonation, lasting bitter, somewhat dry.  Lots of lingering graham cracker. Had to look up to see: yup, I have had Four+ Punkn...Imperial and a touch more characterful, but not much better. Could be cleaner.

750ml bottle picked up at the brewery 
Appearance: Clear dark ruby with a medium sized off-white head that dissipates quickly leaving a small ring and light some lacing 
Appearance: Pumpkin, spices, vanilla and oak 
Aroma: Pumpkin, caramel, oak, nutmeg and hot alcohols 
Nice, a good sipper on a cold night. I admit I was worried that this was going to be over the top with pumpkin, but it wasnt. Well balanced all the way through.

Pours clear, deep amber into a Sam glass. Off-white micro head with medium retention recedes to skim surface leaving spider lacing. Oak, bourbon, and vanilla aromas. Sweet oak and vanilla upfront turning to nutmeg and allspice before the lasting hot bourbon finish.

Bottle, shared by Evan at the local bottle shop.  Thanks.  pours a reddish orange, mostly translucent, with little to no head.  Nose has lots of banana, nutmeg, pumpkin.  Didnt pick up much bourbon.  Flavor is sweet, more nutmeg, banana, meh.  Its okay.  Had no idea about the bourbon aging and didnt notice it at all. Alcohol pretty well controlled, would never have guessed it was over 10%.

750ml bottle
A:vanilla, pumpkin spices, roasted malts, bourbon
T:pumpkin spices, roasted malts, bourbon, hot alcohol notes
One of the better pumpkin beers that I have had. Lots going on. The hot alcohol was the weak point in this beer.

750 ml bottle bought at the Brewery. Pours a very clear ruby color with a medium white head. A very sweet spicy nose with tons of cloves and pumpkin. A rich flavor of pumpkin, berries, some warmth, pumpkin, light oak and vanilla. Quite nice. Sort of reminds me of a Belgian Ale made with spices and pumpkin.
